Re Carol: In Prague, Czech insurgents murdered surrendered German soldiers and German civilians both before and after the arrival of the Red Army.[105] Historian Robert Pynsent [cs] argues that there was no clear-cut distinction between the end of the uprising and the beginning of the expulsions.[106] Some captured German soldiers were hung from lampposts and burned to death,[75][107] or otherwise tortured and mutilated.[108] Czech rioters also assaulted, raped, and robbed German civilians.[21] Not all those killed or affected by anti-German violence were actually German or collaborators, as perpetrators frequently acted on suspicion,[105][109] or exploited the chaos to settle personal grudges.[110] In one massacre at Bořislavka on 10 May, forty German civilians were murdered.[111] During and after the uprising, thousands of German civilians and surrendered soldiers were interned in makeshift camps where food and hygiene were poor. Survivors claimed that beatings and rape were commonplace.[112][113] The violence against German civilians continued throughout the summer, culminating in the expulsion of Sudeten Germans. About three million Czechoslovak citizens of German ethnicity were stripped of their citizenship and property and forcibly deported.[114]

我时常会设想这么一个场景：一位神祇将你剥离出了一切现实，命令你回答一道是非题，如果回答错误你就会不复存在。我籍这个场景来区分，一个命题究竟是我“相信”的，还是我“希望自己相信'的——只有在前者的情况下，我才会对这个命题回答“是”。
于是我会好奇，如果桃花石人在这个场景中，它们果真会对“美国人创造了武汉病毒”、“美国总统悬赏印第安人的头皮”、“回纥的突厥人没有受到迫害”作出肯定的答复吗？难道桃花石人的灵魂中没有一丝不曾腐坏的理性残存？我不得而知。无论如何，我知道自己会对神祇说，桃花石必将灭亡。
